title: Avantika jaiswal
author: Avantika jaiswal
content: Yes, I was very excited to share my article here. The article is best on the best Mining pool But please correct me if I am wrong .Because I am new so I explore more. Read More- https://blocksbyte.com/7-best-bitcoin-mining-pools-in-2023-for-maximum-profits/Note- I am not sure About these platform. let me know please if any of this platform is not good.[/b]

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Quote from: Avantika jaiswal on July 08, 2023, 07:21:16 AMYes, I was very excited to share my article here. The article is best on the best Mining pool But please correct me if I am wrong .Because I am new so I explore more. Read More- https://blocksbyte.com/7-best-bitcoin-mining-pools-in-2023-for-maximum-profits/I don't really understand what your article adds, it just advises the well-known pools for mining Bitcoin and certain altcoins.They're common knowledge, and a simple internet search will take you there.Quote To mine digital currencies, users must pay exorbitant fees.Isn't that the one and only purpose of a cryptocurrency mining pool, to mine cryptocurrencies? Why are you talking about high fees? Are you talking about minimum withdrawals? Quote from: Avantika jaiswal on July 08, 2023, 07:21:16 AMNote- I am not sure About these platform. let me know please if any of this platform is not good.[/b]In my humble opinion, you should never recommend any site, mining pools or not, that you haven't tried out yourself. It doesn't add any value.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: I always look at the statistics herehttps://miningpoolstats.stream/PEGA Pool doesn't even have a hashrate of 1EH/s. I am not a Bitcoin mining expert, but I think in bitcoin mining, as well as in video card mining, miners vote with their hashrate for the best pool.
